poem:
Engagement  

In the corridors of power,  
a shadow leans delicate—  
a weave of whispers  
among royalty and dragon scales,  
poised between handshake  
and suspicion.  

A dance of alliances,  
where winds of cooperation  
lift threads of doubt,  
unknown steps  
leading us where  
climates of secret  
meet breaths of change.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "MPs press for answers on alleged Chinese spy who befriended Prince Andrew – UK politics live 11.06am GMT Asked again about China, Starmer says: Our approach is the approach I’ve just set out. It’s important to engage. Of course, we have to challenge where we must, but it’s better to engage, to challenge, than to stay aside, as it were, important to cooperate where we can on issues like climate change, which need that cooperation.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: MPs press for answers on alleged Chinese spy who befriended Prince Andrew – UK politics live 11.06am GMT Asked again about China, Starmer says: Our approach is the approach I’ve just set out. It’s important to engage. Of course, we have to challenge where we must, but it’s better to engage, to challenge, than to stay aside, as it were, important to cooperate where we can on issues like climate change, which need that cooperation.
